questions.question: …………………….. their best efforts, they could not save him.
questions.description: Either despite or in spite of is possible here.

questions.question: ……………………. she does not have impressive looks, she is confident.
questions.description: Though is a conjunction. Use it to introduce a clause.

questions.question: He has everything ……………………, he is not happy.
questions.description: However is a transitional adverb use a full stop or a semicolon before however.

questions.question: They worked hard …………………….. they couldn’t meet the deadline.
questions.description: But is a conjunction connecting two independent clauses.

questions.question: ………………….. I have known her for a long time, we are not close friends.
……………………. working hard, we couldn’t finish the job on time.
questions.description: Despite is a preposition. Use it before a noun or an ing form.

questions.question: She has a good job ………………….., she never seems to have enough money.
………………….. she is younger than me, I always look up to her.
questions.description: Though is a conjunction used to connect two contrasting ideas.

questions.question: She eats a lot ……………………, she does not gain weight.
questions.description: However is a transitional adverb. Use it after a full stop or a semicolon.

questions.question: ……………………… eating a lot, she does not gain weight.
………………………… she eats a lot, she does not gain weight.
It might sound strange, ……………………. I don’t like cricket.
questions.description: But is used to connect two independent clauses expressing contrasting ideas.
